greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle of distinct values M(n) of multinomial coefficients for partitions of n in increasing order of n and M(n).
comment: Differs from A036038 after a(37). To illustrate where the difference comes from, consider 4,1,1,1 and 3,2,2 are two different partitions of 7 having the same value of multinomial coefficient M(n)=n!/(m1!*m2!*...*mk!)=210.
There is no known formula for M(n) sequence, however the asymptotic behavior has been studied, see the paper by Andrews, Knopfmacher, and Zimmermann.
The number of terms per row (for each value of n starting with n=1) forms sequence A070289.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Rows n = 1..29, flattened
George E. Andrews, Arnold Knopfmacher, and Burkhard Zimmermann, On the Number of Distinct Multinomial Coefficients, arXiv:math/0509470 [math.CO], 2005.
example: Thus for n=4 (fourth row) the distinct values of multinomial coefficients are:
maple: b:= proc(n, i) option remember; `if`(n=0 or i<2, {1},
mathematica: b[n_, i_] := b[n, i] = If[n==0 || i<2, {1}, Union[Flatten @ Table[(#*i!^j&) /@ b[n-i*j, i-1], {j, 0, n/i}]]]; T[n_] := Sort[Flatten[n!/#& /@ b[n, n]] ]; Table[T[n], {n, 1, 10}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Feb 05 2017, after _Alois P. Heinz_ *)
results.author: _Sergei Viznyuk_, Mar 18 2012
